top_categories.workout_context: The Range rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 100 miles, The Range punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
The Range’s alberta mountains, canadian gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at The Range when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing The Range isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of The Range. Make this intensity feel like home.
The Range’s alberta mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at The Range intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The Range’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at The Range — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
At 100 miles, The Range rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for The Range — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for The Range’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at The Range. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at The Range requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on alberta mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: alberta mountains, canadian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Durability, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 100 miles of alberta mountain gravel in Alberta, Canada.
